problem_text:
Let G be a finite group admitting a regular elementary abelian group of automorphisms V of order pn. Is it true that the subgroup H = T_{v∈V \{1\}} [G, v] is nilpotent? In the case of an affirmative answer, does there exist a function depending only on p, n, and the derived length of G which bounds the nilpotency class of H?
P. V. Shumyatski˘ı
